dmca.title: Notice ID: 21-1126444 Notice of violation of TradeMark and /or Intellectual Property
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: symantec-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com
[mailto:symantec-no-reply@copyright-compliance.com] 
Posted At: Friday, August 25, 2006 8:20 PM
Posted To: Copyright
Conversation: Notice ID: 21-1126444 Notice of violation of TradeMark and
/or Intellectual Property Rights
Subject: Notice ID: 21-1126444 Notice of violation of TradeMark and /or
Intellectual Property Rights


-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

25 Aug 2006 18:02:19 GMT
21-1126444
Subject: Symantec Corporation Notice of Posted Crack/ Codes / Keygens
Theplanet.Com Internet Services

Gentlepersons:

I am writing on behalf of Symantec Corporation. Symantec owns the
trademarks and holds the copyrights for numerous computer software
products, including but not limited to antivirus software products sold
under the U.S. registered trademarks NORTON SYSTEMWORKS(r), NORTON
ANTIVIRUS(r), and other software bearing the Norton(R) or Symantec(R)
brand names.  Symantec also holds the registered trademark in the U.S.
and other countries for its name, SYMANTEC(r).  Symantec's rights are
evidenced by, among other things, registrations of its trademarks and
copyrights with the United States Patent and Trademark Office and the
United States Copyright Office.  Symantec also includes product
activation technology in its products to prevent access by unauthorized
parties to its copyrighted products, including without limitation,
product subscription updates, renewals and activations.

Symantec has been notified that you provide Internet access for the IP
address listed below.  We have determined that this site is posting
unauthorized Symantec product crack codes and/or keygen or other
instructions for public distribution that enable unauthorized parties to
illegally activate or extend Symantec's copyrighted product
subscriptions and/or product key activations on a server registered to
the party listed below.  The URL for the crack instructions is listed
herein.  A screenshot of these instructions taken from the site is
attached, together with the homepage of the posting website.


Such distribution is not authorized by Symantec, its agents or the law,
and thus constitutes infringement, among other things.  

As you know, unauthorized use of Symantec's trademarks, and unauthorized
copying and/or distribution of Symantec's copyrighted works, is a
violation of federal and state laws.  It is illegal to produce, sell or
distribute such unauthorized works.  Distribution of devices that can be
used to disable protective technologies that prevent unauthorized use of
Symantec's copyrighted products is also a violation of federal law.  In
particular, Section 1201 of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act
proscribes devices or services that are primarily designed or produced
to circumvent technological measures that prevent unauthorized access to
a copyrighted work.

Based on the above, the deliberate and clear infringement of Symantec's
protected copyright and trademark rights, and the harm to Symantec's
business and goodwill from the infringing use, Symantec demands that you
immediately investigate and take action to stop this infringing
activity, and inform us of the results of your actions.  Symantec
believes that the entire Internet community benefits when these matters
are resolved cooperatively.  Accordingly, we appreciate your efforts
toward this common goal.

The information contained in this notification is accurate.  Under
penalty of perjury, the undersigned is authorized to act on behalf of
Symantec with respect to this matter.

Please be advised that this letter is not and is not intended to be a
complete statement of the facts or law as they may pertain to this
matter or to Symantec's positions, rights or remedies, legal or
equitable, all of which are specifically reserved.

Thank you for your immediate assistance regarding this matter.

Please respond indicating the actions you have taken to resolve this
matter.  The provided link has been assigned to this matter:
http://webreply.baytsp.com/webreply/webreply.jsp?customerid=21&commhash=
23474572220d87f097dd900ae0eb392b. 

For email correspondence, please reference the above-referenced
21-1126444 in the subject line and email:
mailto:symantec2@copyright-compliance.com?subject=RE%3A%20Notice%20ID%3A
%2021%2D1126444%20Notice%20of%20violation%20of%20TradeMark%20and%20%2For
%20Intellectual%20Property%20Rightssubject.

Sincerely,

Chansonette Connolly
Manager, Global Anti-Piracy and
Intellectual Property Enforcement Programs Legal Department Symantec
Corporation www.symantec.com


Fax: (650) 527-2521
Email: symantec@copyright-compliance.com
